Title: Chief Investment Office
Company: Công Ty Cổ Phần Phát Triển Bất Động Sản Filmore
Location: 357-359 An Dương Vương, Phường 3, Quận 5, TP. Hồ Chí Minh, 357-359 An Dương Vương, P.3, Q.5, HCM
Job Description:
I. Job Role
Planning and overall management of the company's investment activities; developing investment plans; evaluating the feasibility of projects; organizing land development; conducting M&A to generate revenue and profits.
II. Responsibilities
1. Planning and overall management of investment activities:
• Implement and monitor investment plans, ensuring investment projects maintain liquidity according to the established plans.
• Negotiate, monitor the signing and execution of investment contracts, as well as other agreements with partners.
2. Organizing land development and investment appraisal:
• Conduct analysis and synthesis of input and output information of potential projects. Evaluate potential projects based on appraisal criteria to assess their exploitable efficiency.
• Develop investment structures, feasible implementation plans, and adjustment plans when relevant changes occur. Conduct comprehensive analysis, review, and examination of projects and enterprises. Participate in necessary field surveys to compile comprehensive risk assessment reports and propose implementation solutions.
• Establish medium and long-term project development plans.
• Seek clean land funds and investment opportunities.
• Establish relationships, nurture, and maintain the development of relationships with individuals, organizations, and agencies involved in land fund search and investment projects.
• Appraise, evaluate, propose, and provide advice on selecting investment possibilities and investment plans.
• Submit investment proposals for approval.
• Negotiate with partners regarding investment cooperation, joint ventures, and partnerships for project implementation.
3. Monitor, analyze, and report on investment effectiveness for ongoing projects:
• Report to and advise the CEO on investment plans that yield optimal efficiency.
• Report to the CEO on project implementation and progress, ensuring timely fulfillment of investment stages.
4. Manage and oversee the operations of the Investment Department:
• Ensure effective implementation of all activities within the Investment Department, achieving business objectives.
• Manage the Investment, Investment Legal, External Relations teams, delegate tasks, and foster collaboration and individual development within the department.
5. Perform other tasks as required by BOD.
Job Requirements:
a. Education
• Bachelor's degree or above
• Possess knowledge in accounting and finance, capital markets,
real estate market, and the process of real estate project
investment.
b. Knowledge
• None required
c. Certificate
• None required
d. Experience
• Professional experience
• At least 10 years of experience
• Management experience
• At least 05 years in an equivalent position.
• Proficient in using English in work.
• Proficient in computer skills: Excel, PowerPoint.
e. Specific skills/ Other
• Team management skills.
• Presentation skills.
• Negotiation skills.
• Responsibility
f. Personal qualities
• Integrity
• Innovation
Level: Giám Đốc và Cấp Cao Hơn
Keyword: Công Ty Cổ Phần Phát Triển Bất Động Sản Filmore

Title: Vice Director (Health & Beauty)
Company: The Vigo
Location: Số 3, đường số 33, Phường An Khánh, TP Thủ Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Số 3 đường 33, Phường An Khánh, Tp.Thủ Đức, HCM
Job Description:
Strategic Planning & Market Leadership:
• Advise and collaborate with the Executive Board in defining business goals, category development directions, and integrated business–marketing strategies for the Health & Beauty category.
• Conduct in-depth market analysis and trend forecasting to proactively shape and adjust strategies, ensuring the achievement of revenue, profit, and market coverage objectives.
• Develop, implement, and continuously improve operational policies, frameworks, and procedures for the team to ensure alignment, efficiency, and scalability.
• Design and lead distribution channel expansion strategies tailored to the Health & Beauty sector, including channel segmentation, partner acquisition, and go-to-market models.

Business Operations Management & Market Development:
• Lead and oversee end-to-end business operations to ensure the achievement of approved revenue, volume, and KPI targets across the Health & Beauty category.
• Execute trade programs, promotional campaigns, and sell-out initiatives at points of sale to stimulate consumer demand and accelerate market performance.
• Build and maintain strong, strategic partnerships with key accounts including cosmetic retail chains, pharmacies, wholesalers, and other critical distribution partners.
• Proactively identify and pursue new market opportunities, staying ahead of consumer trends and competitive shifts to formulate timely and effective go-to-market responses.

Brand Strategy & Category Positioning:
• Monitor market trends, consumer behavior, and competitor activities to uncover actionable insights and refine brand strategy.
• Analyze market data to define brand positioning, identify target consumer insights, and map brand growth opportunities.
• Lead the development and implementation of market entry and brand positioning strategies aligned with corporate vision, mission, and long-term objectives.
• Ensure alignment of brand identity, messaging, and tone across all channels and touchpoints to build a consistent, compelling brand experience.
• Develop creative concepts and strategic ideas for brand communication campaigns, ensuring strong resonance with target audiences and alignment with brand positioning.
• Monitor marketing and advertising activities to ensure consistency with product strategy.

Commercial Team Leadership & Sales Enablement:
• Manage and coordinate the sales force, set clear targets and KPIs, and regularly monitor performance.
• Develop and implement customer acquisition and retention strategies to expand market share and increase penetration across regions and channels.
• Foster strong, long-term client relationships through value-added solutions, service excellence, and strategic account management.
• Optimize the sales process from planning and lead generation to closing deals and post-sale support to drive operational efficiency and customer satisfaction.
Talent Development & Performance Management:
• Lead recruitment, onboarding, and training initiatives for team members within the category.
• Define individual and team performance metrics, conduct regular reviews, and provide constructive feedback for continuous improvement.
• Foster a collaborative, high-performance work environment through motivation, recognition, and team empowerment.

Reporting:
• Prepare and deliver regular reports on category performance, sales results, campaign effectiveness, and key business metrics to the Executive Board.
• Regularly generate business performance analysis and forecasting reports to support strategic decision-making at the executive level.
• Take on additional projects or initiatives as assigned by the Board of Directors.
Job Requirements:
Education:
- Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Pharmaceutical Sciences, or related fields.
- Possess deep expertise in the Health & Beauty sector, with a strong understanding of pharmaceutical and cosmetic products, formulations, and consumer needs.

Years of Experience:
Minimum 5 years in a senior leadership role in the Health & Beauty, Cosmetics, or FMCG industry.

Skill:
Foreign Language Proficiency: Fluent in English (all 4 skills).
Computer Skills: Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word). Familiarity with CRM and analytics tools is a plus.

Visionary Leadership & Market Acumen:
- Strategic Thinking & Business Acumen: Ability to analyze market dynamics, competitors, consumer trends, and macroeconomic factors to formulate a clear, long-term vision and well-defined strategic objectives for the Healthy & Beauty category.
- Leadership & Change Management: Ability to lead teams and the organization through periods of change, adapting to new business environments.
- Proven capability in market analysis, trend forecasting, and strategic decision-making, with hands-on experience in analyzing marketing and business performance data.

Industry Expertise (Cosmetics & Supplements):
- Category Management: Experience in optimizing product portfolios, including new product launches, existing product enhancements, and the discontinuation of underperforming products.
- Deep understanding of key product categories in the cosmetics and supplement sectors, including skincare, haircare, emerging technologies, active ingredients, and product development processes.
- Solid knowledge of legal and regulatory frameworks governing the production, importation, distribution, and advertising of cosmetics and supplements (e.g., product registration, labeling, marketing compliance).
- Hands-on experience in end-to-end product development—from concept creation and market research to R&D coordination, product launch, and lifecycle optimization.
- Comprehensive understanding of the entire value chain: from raw material sourcing, manufacturing, and quality control to logistics and distribution.
- Proven experience in developing omnichannel distribution strategies, including e-commerce, pharmacy chains, supermarkets, cosmetics retail stores, and modern trade.
- Strong grasp of consumer behavior in the Health & Beauty category, with the ability to analyze purchasing trends, identify unmet needs, and develop tailored product and channel strategies for different customer segments.

Key Traits & Behavioral Competencies:
- Energetic, creative, honest, with a highly professional working style.
- Strong sense of responsibility, adaptable, and able to perform under high pressure.
- Excellent communication and negotiation skills in professional settings.
- Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making capabilities.
- Competent in task delegation and authority distribution within teams.
- Effective time management and prioritization skills.
- System management capabilities with a structured and process-driven mindset.
- Proven ability to motivate, inspire, and engage team members to achieve high performance.
Field: Làm đẹp (Mỹ phẩm) & Chăm sóc cá nhân
Level: Giám Đốc và Cấp Cao Hơn
Keyword: Làm đẹp (Mỹ phẩm) & Chăm sóc cá nhân

Title: UI/UX Designer
Company: Ngân Hàng TMCP Quốc Tế Việt Nam (VIB)
Location: Hồ Chí Minh, Việt Nam, Tầng 1 (Tầng trệt) và Tầng 2 Tòa nhà Sailing Tower, Số 111A Pasteur, Phường Bến Nghé, Quận 1, TP Hồ Chí Minh, Việt Nam
Job Description:
Purpose: As a UI/UX Designer, you will lead the design process from conceptualization to implementation, ensuring the development of innovative and high-quality products that align with user requirements and company standards. You will collaborate with a cross-functional team, including front-end engineers, product owners, and subject matter experts, to create exceptional user experiences.

1. UX Design
- Conduct competitive analysis and research.
- Collaborate with product teams to propose UI/UX solutions.
- Utilize research data to inform design decisions.
- Work according to the UX design process for new product projects.
- Present work to stakeholders, gather feedback, and make updates.
- Conduct UI/UX audits and contribute to product improvements.
- Evaluate FAT/UAT testing and user adoption.
- Directly test and evaluate the usability of projects (Usability test, A/B testing, Survey, Interview,...)..

2. UI Design (Interaction & Graphic Design)
- Deeply understand design system principles and practices.
- Create, maintain, and advocate for adopting the Design system, providing guidance to other designers and developers to ensure its successful implementation.
- Ensure consistency in design elements across the product to create a cohesive visual identity.
- Work closely with developers to implement designs accurately and troubleshoot any design-related issues during the development process.
- Design intuitive and visually appealing user interfaces that align with best UX and UI design practices.
- Produce compelling graphics, images, animations, and motion graphics using Adobe Creative Suite.
Job Requirements:
Requirements:
- Bachelor s degree in any field is welcomed.
- Minimum 7 years (Senior Specialist)/ 5 years (Specialist)/3 years (Senior Officer)/2 years (Officer) of experience in UI/UX design for web and mobile apps.
- Your portfolio is required as part of recruitment process for this position. We recommend that the portfolio demonstrates your thinking process, exploration, visual and design perspective behind your work.

1. Design
- Demonstrable experience designing and maintaining a Design System.
- Proficiency in design tools such as Figma and Adobe Creative Suite.
- Solid understanding of design principles.
- Strong graphic design skills and ability to convey information visually.
- Understand the concept of design guidelines, best practices, and UI standards.
- Experience with prototyping to demonstrate interactive designs and user flows.
- Passion for staying updated with the latest design trends and technologies.
- Problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
- Basic experienced about animation, After Effects, and Lottie, audio and video editing is an advantage.

2. Communication
- Ability to speaking and writing in a clear, concise and organized manner for the intended audience.
- Ability to effectively present information to groups of managers, team members and customers.
- Personal qualities: Teamwork, reliable, leadership, integrity, trustworthy, punctuality, creativity, confience, courageous, flexibility, interpersonal skills.

3. Other
- Able to perform Research and Development (R&D), and keep updates with trends.
- Able to propose, define, and optimize processes.
- Able to train and grow competencies for self and others.
Keyword: Ngân Hàng TMCP Quốc Tế Việt Nam (VIB)

Title: Accountant - Competitive Salary - US Based Company
Company: Irvine Construction Cost Accounting - USA Accounting
Location: Lầu 2, 9 Đường 29, khu dân cư, Hiệp Bình Phước, Thủ Đức, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, Vietnam HQ1: 236 Nguyen Xi, Ward 13, Binh Thanh District, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job Description:
At Irvine Construction Cost Accounting, an America-based tax and accounting firm, we mentor and train new graduates/fresh candidates to become skilled general accountants. Our training system has been developed to take the information you learned from your university education and apply it in practical ways in the field of accounting. As part of our Accounting Team you will:

- Learn how to work with American accounting practices and rules.
- Familiarize yourself with the intricacies of the US banking system to gather relevant documents for our bookkeeping and accounting departments.
- Maintain accurate records of financial transactions.
- Reconcile transactions into accounting systems utilizing Best Practices of the accounting industry.
- Engage in email communication with American clients to clarify any transaction-related matters.
- Acquire expertise in advanced accounting principles to support specialized industries within corporate America.
Job Requirements:
- Graduates majoring in Accounting - Finance, Economics from domestic and international universities.
- Candidates with experience in financial accounting in domestic and international companies would take precedence.
- Candidates with experience in accounting software such as QuickBooks, Sage would take precedence.
- English proficiency is recommended as communicating with our American clients is required.
- Females only.
- Proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
- Great communication and interpersonal skills.
- Effective time management and organizational skills.
– Pride in the quality of your work.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* * * Working Hours
- Monday - Friday: 8:00AM- 5:15PM (Except for statutory holidays.)
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* * * Benefits
- Salary: from 10 millions (net pay)
- Evaluation every 3- 6 months
- Overtime pay
- Bonus
- Supportive team/environment
- Other allowances after completing the probationary period (13th-month salary, leave allowance, holiday allowance, partial support in insurance).
- Team-building activities
- Computers provided
Keyword: Irvine Construction Cost Accounting - USA Accounting
